subject: Perl Advent Calendar
header: How you all doing? Are you making the most of festive season?

In the 540th edition of the weekly newsletter, I mentioned Advent Calendar. I did see some activities in the GitHub repository for Perl Advent Calendar. I was hoping to see another exciting edition full of Perl projects. A friend of mine on Facebook mentioned that this year Perl Advent Calendar is looking a bit sparse. At the time of writing this editorial, I only saw one post i.e. Day 1 of Year 2021. Being one of many contributors in the past, I am sad to see the current state. I have absolutely no idea what happened this year. I know I have too many things already on my plate but I would like to help to get Perl Advent Calendar back to its original glory.

Talking about Advent Calendar, I would like to mention about The Weekly Challenge Advent Calendar which has mix of Perl and Raku like in the past. We have been running this since the beginning i.e. 2019. You will find some of the fun tasks from the past one year being discussed by members of Team PWC. I have made slight change to the look and feel this time. I hope you like it too
How about 24 Pull Requests event?

I have not seen it being discussed either on any of the social platforms e.g. Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn. I haven't had chance to take part this year. I couldn't take part last year too, what a shame. I still have 10 days and I have booked few days off from work. So there is a possibility I might take part and even complete the challenge. Please wish me luck.

Last but not the least, Curtis, leading the project Corinna, announced that he had a great meeting with the Perl Steering Council and they are extremely receptive to Corinna going into the core. I can't wait for Corinna being part of core Perl. Damian shared the details on one of issues discussed in the same meeting in the blog. You definitely don't want to miss it.
